Armed with 4 LPPC’s and an ER Large Laser, the 8K retains the 5H’s head mounted LRM-5; albeit with the inclusion of CAE II to protect the ammo bay. Склонность: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: The Griffin 3N is a Free Worlds variant designed to improve on the performance of the standard Griffin in almost all aspects of the design. Armed with an ER PPC and an Enhanced LRM-10 with Artemis IV, the Griffin 3N can fight at much longer ranges than would be expected from a standard Griffin. Case II and heavier armour round out the design, making it much more resistant to damage or ammunition explosions. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: This variant of the Griffin was based on the 6S. By dropping one of the ER medium lasers, the Artemis system, and using a Clan-spec LRM-15, engineers found enough room to add a C3 Boosted Slave and a Targeting Computer. CASE II protects the LRM ammunition. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: Built for speed, firepower, and simplicity, the Gyrfalcon became common in Jade Falcon Stars. Its 275-Rated Extra-Light Fusion Engine would help propel the design into the battlefield at 86 kph and at bursts to 108 kph with the help of its MASC. Included in its construction is a Partial Wing, which gives the design the ability to jump further than the normal 150 meters that its Jump Jets would be capable of. In addition to its regular sensors, the engineers would fit a Light Active Probe in the 'Mech's head to help it identify potential enemy targets.While it has been noted that its MechWarriors have it customized for their purposes, this design's original weapons layout consisted of two Series 6b Extended Range Large Lasers and two Type OVR-V LB 2-X ACs mounted in its shortened arms actuators. In addition to these ranged weapons systems, engineers would go on to reinforce the Gyrfalcon's legs. This is a nod to their touman changing its attitude towards the use of physical attacks, namely using Death from Above maneuver. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original: Produced with a mix of Inner Sphere and Clan technologies, the fourth variant of the Gyrfalcon carries a pair of TSEMP Cannons in place of the original's Autocannons. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original: Aleksandr Hazen: Arguably the Gyrfalcon’s most famous MechWarrior, he was Galaxy Commander of Zeta Galaxy during the Clan's desant into the Republic of the Sphere in 3134. Piloting his 'Mech which he named the White Lily, he would artfully cut through enemy forces in the Republic until reaching Prefecture IX's Capital of Skye. With his sibkin, Galaxy Commander Malvina Hazen, they would nearly take the world through his methods. However, he would be killed in action with Prefect Tara Campbell at the hands of her Hatchetman signature weapon. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

content.original: The first OmniMech both designed and built by the Lyran Alliance. The inspiration for the Hauptmann is drawn from the Daishi OmniMech used by the Clans. Using information from captured Daishis and data gleaned from the construction of the Firestarter OmniMech, which was shared by the Draconis Combine, the end result is a powerful OmniMech capable of defending itself in most combat situations. The Hauptmann is built on a standard chassis and powered by a 285 fusion engine, adding to the 'Mech's durability as it cannot be killed by a side torso loss. The Hauptmann has eleven double heat sinks fixed on the chassis and can add more if needed in its various configurations. For protection, the Hauptmann carries eighteen and a half tons of armor and has CASE fixed in the right torso to protect against an ammunition explosion. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

content.original: Developed prior to Gray Monday, the Loki Mk II is a Heavy Class OmniMech, which was originally created for the touman of Clan Jade Falcon. Also known as the Hel internally among the Clans, the Loki is an upgraded version of the venerable Hellbringer developed by Clan Hell's Horses in 2926. The new 'Mech differs from its thirtieth century originator by having heavier equipment capacity and improved armor protection but a lower top speed. The 'Mech would become primarily used by Clans Jade Falcon and Hell's Horses in 3145, where the 'Mech would see action during those Clans' invasions of the Inner Sphere powers such as the Republic of the Sphere and Lyran Commonwealth. A noted action that utilized the Loki was during the Jade Falcon's occupation of Sargasso in 3142. The 9th Talon deployed a binary of Lokis to suppress resistance in the city of Salicastrum. The Cluster's Lokis (fitted with B Configurations) used their Long Tom Cannons to blast rebel forces. However, a Nova of Wolf-In-Exiles forces ambushed the binary, and the ensuing battle rendered half the Jade Falcon Lokis destroyed, however the survivors would withdraw temporarily. A Star's worth of survivors from the 9th would return to force a Clan Wolf retreat and prevent the world from falling back into Commonwealth hands. Quirk: Experimental TC Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: A 65 ton design which emphasises overwhelming firepower over speed or armour, the Hellbringer is a Clan OmniMech. Powered by 325 rated Xl Engine, the Hellbringer has 28.5 tons of pod space. The Hellbringer G is armed with an Inner Sphere Improved Heavy Gauss Rifle and an Improved Heavy Large Laser. A trio of ER Small Lasers cover close range combat. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: An upgrade of the Highlander introduced in 3115, the Highlander 740 is powered by a 270 rated Fusion Core. An ER PPC is paired with an Artemis IV augmented LRM-20 for long range combat, while a Streak SRM-6, 2 M-Pods and a pair of ER Medium Lasers cover close range combat. Quirk: Reinforced Legs Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

content.original: The Hornet debuted in 2760 as an urban recon 'Mech, but lack of interest forced the design to be shelved two years later. In 2990, Kallon Industriesrediscovered the blueprints and resumed production. The upgraded HNT-171 started production in 3051. The production line was destroyed by the Capellans in 3069. The 'Mech is designed around the concept of being able to swiftly move through an urban environment with relatively heavy armor. Overall, because of its eclectic mix of weapons and relatively slow speed, the Hornet is only somewhat effective when inside of a city. When caught outside an urban environment the 'Mech is hard pressed to defend itself. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.95

content.original: A Nova Cat design, the 50 ton Huntsman was designed for Operation Revival and the invasion of the Inner Sphere; first entering production in 3049. An OmniMech, the Huntsman is built around a 250 rated XL Engine with an Endo Steel Skeleton and Ferro Fibrous armour giving the OmniMech, 21.5 tons of pod space. 5 Jump Jets are fixed to the chassis, giving the Huntsman additional flexibility. The Huntsman I is armed with an ER Large Laser and a HAG/20. A Plasma Cannon and an ER Small Pulse Laser provide additional firepower at close range. \n\n Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: A long forgotten prototype, once considered for mass production, the HSR-1000-X dosen't exist in any official record. Built in small quanitties for the Republic of the Sphere's Ghost Knights, the 1000-X carries a single Clan produced ER Large Laser in a turret mount on the right torso. Shrouded in a Chameleon Light Poarisation Shield and equipped with a Supercharger, the 1000-X is a lightening fast ghost; perfect for the specific missions, Ghost Knights specalise in. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.03

content.original: First produced in 2948, the Ice Ferret is a medium scout OmniMech often employed as a head hunter or strike unit. A 45 ton Clan OmniMech, the Ice Ferret is powered by a 360 rated XL Engine and has 9.5 tons of pod space thanks to a combination of Endo Steel, an XL Engine and Ferro-Fibrous. The Ice Ferret IFR-F is armed with a pair of ER Large Lasers. Watchdog CEWS improves the Ice Ferrets defensive and scouting capabilities. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original: One of the Vining Engineering and Salvage Team’s more curious creations, the Ion Raptor is a hand built marque of battlemechs built with salvage from the Clan front lines. First debuting in 3053, the original Ion Raptor was built from the remains of a Masakari and a Crab. The first Ion Raptor to enter mainstream production, the ION-4R rolled out of Earthwerks Incorporated’s Keystone plant in 3088. Designed as an all round trooper mech, the ION-4R is the first variant to include Jump Jets. Armed with a sextet of Light PPC’s and 4 Artemis IV augmented SRM-4’s, the 4R is a solid workhorse, suited to both garrison work and frontline duties. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: One of the Vining Engineering and Salvage Team’s more curious creations, the Ion Raptor is a hand built marque of battlemechs built with salvage from the Clan front lines. First debuting in 3053, the original Ion Raptor was built from the remains of a Masakari and a Crab. Designed in collaboration with Sea Fox merchants, the Ion Raptor 5R is a return to VEST’s roots. Each 5R is hand built to order, mostly for select Solaris stables. Designed to succeed in the Arena and on the battlefield, the 5R is armed with a pair of ER Large Lasers for ranged combat while 4 IHML’s surprise anyone who closes in. 4 Streak LRM-5’s support the ER Lasers, but can engage targets at close range if required. Quirk: Combat Computer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: Originally a 3050's vintage Juggernaut, the JG-R9T14 is a ground-up refit almost entirely consisting of Clan technology. When first appearing in the arena, the JG-R9T14 was quickly nicknamed "The Dreadnought" as it tore through the opposition with its twin Improved Heavy Large Lasers and experimental AP Gauss Rifle Batteries. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

content.original: A Light Clan OmniMech, the 30 ton Kit Fox was introduced in 2890 by Clan Cloud Cobra. Favouring a mix of fire power and armor over speed, the Kit Fox is powered by a 180 XL Engine and features a mix of Endo Steel and Ferro Fibrous; giving it 16 tons of pod space. The Kit Fox I is armed with an ER PPC, an ER Medium Laser and an ER Small Laser. A Targeting Computer, Supercharger and Modular Armor round out the variant. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.99

content.original: Inspired by the success of the Clan Hell’s Horses’ Black Hawk design. Clan Diamond Shark developed what is in essence a simplified, non-Omni version of the older Mist Lynx OmniMech. Primarily for sale to Inner Sphere customers, the Hell's Horses marketing ploy of adopting a familiar designation the 'Mech was dubed the Koshi, a decision that did not sit well with many of the more conservative members of the Clan. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original: Designed as a replacement to the Timber Wolf, the 65 ton Linebacker entered production in 3052. Built around a 390 rated XL Engine, the Linebacker’s faster speed enables it to keep up with lighter star mates in running battles, something the Timber Wolf struggled to do. A combination of Ferro Fibrous armor and Endo Steel give the OmniMech 17.5 tons of free pod space. The Linebacker LBK-G is armed with a pair of Improved Heavy Large Lasers augmented by a Targeting Computer. 3 additional DHS, a pair of SRM-2’s and a Supercharger fill the remaining tonnage. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.content: Designed as a replacement to the Timber Wolf, the 65 ton Linebacker entered production in 3052. Built around a 390 rated XL Engine, the Linebacker’s faster speed enables it to keep up with lighter star mates in running battles, something the Timber Wolf struggled to do. A combination of Ferro Fibrous armor and Endo Steel give the OmniMech 17.5 tons of free pod space. The Linebacker LBK-G is armed with a pair of Improved Heavy Large Lasers augmented by a Targeting Computer. 3 additional DHS, a pair of SRM-2’s and a Supercharger fill the remaining tonnage. Склонность: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: The Lineholder was the first BattleMech design to come from Kressly Warworks. The Lineholder is designed around a set of Common Sense Rules for 'Mech design. This approach has produced a 'Mech with a good ground speed and respectable amount of armor and firepower. The 'Mech has a top speed of 86.4 km/h, allowing it to keep up with all but the fastest light and medium 'Mechs. The Lineholder also carries ten tons of armor protection and has fourteen heat sinks. Its mix of off-the-shelf weapons and equipment makes the Lineholder a reliable 'Mech that is easy to repair and is dependable in battle. However, the ultimate selling point for the Lineholder, especially to its target audience of small units and minor nobles, is value and price. In the first year of sales, the Lineholder was historically successful compared with other 55-ton BattleMechs. For minor factions able to afford brand new BattleMechs, the Lineholder has become the garrison machine of choice. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: A Star League era fire support platform, the Longbow is an 85 ton Assault Mech and one of the most used fire support mechs in existence. The LGB-13C is armed with a sextet of MML-9’s, supported by a ER Medium Laser. A 255 rated Engine, DHS and a Boosted C3 Slave round out the design. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: With the success of the Mad Cat Mk II design Clan Diamond Shark developed the Mad Cat III as a medium 'Mech to accompany the heavy Mad Cat and assault Mad Cat II. Intended for sale to both Inner Sphere and Clan customers, it has been shunned by the Clans save for the Nova Cats and Exiled Wolves as '...an outrage against everything Nicholas Kerensky stood for and taught us.' However, it has proven popular with the Successor States. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.15

content.original: Though bearing a remarkable outward resemblance to the Timberwolf, this BattleMech is a new and powerful creation. Carrying thirteen tons of ferro-fibrous armor, the Mad Cat MK II is an incredibly resilient design. A pair of arm mounted Gaussrifles supported by torso mounted LRM racks give it complete command over the battlefield. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Medium Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

content.original: The personal 'Mech of Calderon's Commando commander Marshal Vrabel von Staskov circa 3088, an ER PPC and Medium Laser are mounted in each arm, supported by a center torso mounted Light AC/5 fed from a single ton of reloads. Built around a 300 rated Light Fusion Engine and clad in Light Ferro-Fibrous armor, von Staskov's 'Mech is fitted with Double Heat Sinks, Jump Jets and Triple Strength Myomer. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

content.original: When the Treaty of Taurus was signed, it established the New Colony Region in co-operation between the Magistracy of Canopus and the Taurian Concordat and also created the Colonial Marshals. This variant of the Marshal was introduced during the Dark Age. It carries a TSEMP Cannon, MML-9 with a three ton ammunition bay, two Machine Guns, a Flamer, a Medium Laser, and a Medium Pulse Laser. It is otherwise identical to the original Marshal. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: Designed for direct fire support, the Mauler 4R is a Davion take on the classic Kuritan design. Built around a pair of RAC/5's, the 4X carries 6 tons of ammo. Backing this up is a pair of snub nose ppc's and Artemis enhanced srm-6's, allowing the Mauler to cripple or kill enemies seeking to close on the slow mech. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

content.original: Designed as a close range brawler, the Merlin 1E is marketed to smaller periphery states and mercenary commands in the market for a cut price heavy mech. Replacing the traditional PPC with an AC/10 and removing the anti personel weapons, allows for an extra pair of Medium Lasers to be added.With a third less heatsinks than the usual Merlin designs, pilots will need to be careful with their heat or risk a premature ammo explosion. Quirk: Easy to Maintain Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

content.original: Debuting in 3085, the latest generation of the Mongoose incorporates a wide array of new and updated technology. Not designed for head to head combat, this scout still posses a surprisingly nasty bite at close range; perfect for hunting and killing other scout units. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

Не предназначенный для боя лицом к лицу, этот разведчик все еще может неприятно удивить на близком расстоянии. Идеально подходит для выслеживания и убийства других разведчиков. Склонность: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original: An upgrade of the Mongoose introduced in 3129, the Mongoose MON-96 is powered by a 200 rated Light Engine augmented by a Supercharger. Armed with 3 ER Medium Lasers and an ER Small Laser, the MON-96 carries a Bloodhound Active Probe in the right torso. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.98

content.original: A Regulan design built to emulate the Lyran Berzerker, the Neandertal is an 80 ton Battlemech designed around two concepts – speed and close combat. A 400 rated XL Engine paired with TSM helps achieve the first objective, while a massive Hatchet makes the Neanderthal deadly in close quarters. The Neanderthal NTL-AG is armed with a pair of Snub Nose PPC’s augmented by a PPC Capacitor. A trio of Rocket Launchers provide additional punch in close quarters, while Guardian ECM rounds out the mech. Quirk: Distracting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original: The Omen is a Clan Assault BattleMech that was created by Clan Snow Raven in the post-Jihad era. Designed as an all-purpose combat unit, the Omen is considered to be slower than the typical late thirty-first century Clan Assault BattleMech. However, its well-rounded weaponry and its 16.5 tons of Standard Armor allows it to be durable in combat. Also to help with its lack of speed, the Omen has been given three Jump Jets, which allow the 'Mech to tactically position itself up to 90 meters in the air and effectively use its weapons. Quirk: Protected Actuators Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

content.original: Designed as a cost effective Assault grade battlemech, the Onager OGR-1 was created by the Jade Falcons to replace captured Inner Sphere mechs used by Garrison troops. A 270 rated Fusion Core and an Endo Steel chassis allow the mech to carry a mammoth HAG/30. Supporting this are a pair of Medium Pulse Lasers and a pair of SRM-6’s with 2 Micro Pulse Lasers and a Small Pulse Laser deterring Infantry. Quirk: Battle Fists Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

content.original: The customized Orion IIC piloted by Knight of the Sphere Burton Davion at time of death during the Capellan Crusades removes all weaponry save the ER Large Lasers, swapping the SRM launcher for a Streak LRM-15, the torso mounted-LRM rack for an ATM-3 and the Gauss Rifle for a HAG/20, two tons of ammunition carried for each weapon. Burton's 'Mech used a XL Engine to free up the weight for this weaponry as well four Jump Jets and a Light Active Probe. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

content.original: Developed in 3139, the OSP-36 was the first non-prototype Advanced Point Defense System-equipped BattleMech introduced by the Republic Armed Forces. To mount a APDS system and a ton of ammo in each arm, the OSP-36 drops the Beagle probe and ER Small Laser entirely, replacing the Gauss Rifle with an ER PPC supported by a Radical Heat Sink System to free up the required weight while allowing the variant to remain combat-effective. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: Conceptualised as a long range support platform, the Pendragon was a result of House Davion’s Jihad era MUSE programs. A 95 ton mech, the Pendragon is built around a 380 rated XL Engine and is loosely based on the Templar OmniMech. The Pendragon PDR-1R is the first production model and unlike the original prototype is entirely built with Inner Sphere technology. A pair of Extended Range LRM-15’s provide extreme range fire power, while an ER PPC and a trio of ER Medium Lasers provide closer ranged firepower. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.17

content.original: The first BattleMech to utilize the advanced Void Signature System, while reports of 'invisible 'Mechs' had long been ignored as confusion for such Star League era stealth systems as the Null Signature System and Chameleon Light Polarization Shield, allowed the 'Stealth Raptor' to be used with deadly effect. Quirk: Jammer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original: The next generation of the Capellan Confederation's iconic Raven scout BattleMech, the main difference between the Raven II and the original Raven is that this new 'Mech seems to be meant for scout hunting and breaking through enemy lines, as opposed to the latter's fire support role. These new roles are played with the use of a Firmir Hypnos Tight-Stream Electromagnetic Pulse Cannon mounted in the 'Mech's left arm. Quirk: Improved Sensors Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original: A dedicated electronic warfare and scout Mech, the 35 ton Raven has seen continuous service since it entered service in 2024. Powered by a 280 rated XL Engine, the Raven 5L is armoured in Stealth Armour and mounting Angel ECM. Armed with a Narc Launcher and a TAG for spotting and tagging hostile units, the Raven 5L mounts a pair of ER Medium Lasers and 3 SRM-2’s for close range combat. \n\n Quirk: Jammer Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: A Garrison Mech constructed by the newly formed Escorpion Imperio in 3086, the 35 ton Reptar is essentially an up-gunned Industrial Mech. Designed to free up more capable machines for the front lines, the Reptar is usually deployed to protect command posts and other key infrastructure; only entering combat in the events of an emergency or enemy attack. Powered by a 175 rated fuel Cell, the Reptar is armed with a ProtoMech AC/8 and a pair of LMG’s. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.78

content.original: After the Free Worlds League acquired the Silver Bullet Gauss Rifle technology from House Davion they put out a request for an experimental platform to trial the new weapons on. The RFL-7G was introduced by Kallon Industries in 3085 as their answer, mounting two Silver Bullet Gauss Rifles instead of the Autocannon-based weaponry their other models used. Due to the larger size and need for more ammunition bins the 'Mech could only fit 2 Extended Range Medium Lasers as the complementary armament. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original: This variant was produced during the Jihad as a field refit kit but didn't see large usage until the early days of the Republic. Using an Endo Steel chassis, XL Gyro, and XL engine allowed designers to increase the top speed to 97 km/h and include six jump jets. Light Ferro-Fibrous armor protects the 'Mech, while each arm mounts a Light PPC and Snub-Nose PPC. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.08

content.original: The Scarecrow is a rare BattleMech that Corean Enterprises produced from their plant on Augusta, although the Armed Forces of the Federated Suns officially disavowed knowledge of the Scarecrow until the 3140s. Incorporating mixed Clan and Inner Sphere technology, the Scarecrow was designed to be very effective at killing its intended target - infantry. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.06

content.original: This variant went by the unfortunate nickname Hobbled Scarecrow - it was an attempt to produce a version of the Scarecrow that could serve more ably in combat against other BattleMechs, although thin armor and limited speed made the Scarecrow a poor choice for such battles even with the revised weapons loadout. The Hobbled Scarecrow lacked the Machine Gun Arrays of the original and the Chameleon Light Polarization Shield, mounting three Medium Lasers instead, one located in each arm and one in the right torso. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

content.original: Based on the Golden Age Storm Giant, the Scylla is an updated model developed by the Steel Vipers as a second line Battlemech. A 100 ton mech with a 400 rated XL Engine, the Scylla SCY-3 is armed with a LB-20X and a HAG-30. An ER PPC and a Heavy Large Laser give the Scylla a heavier punch at range. Quirk: Rugged Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.24

content.original: Based on the lighter Shadow Cat OmniMech, the Shadow Cat II is a heavy Clan Jade Falcon fire-support BattleMech. This variant developed in 3089 carries four Streak SRM-6 launchers, supplemented by a single ER Large Laser and ER Medium Laser. This version is more intended for close in fighting rather than the long range fire support of the original. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

This Dark Age configuration introduced in 3092 carries two LRM-10 launchers and a Gauss Rifle. It removes a single jump jet, which means it can only cover 150 meters per jump. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

content.original: Taking a cue from Clan Jade Falcon’s Thor II, introduced during the previous decade, Nova Cat scientists removed the original Shadow Cat’s fixed jump jets to free valuable mass. Most of the remaining tonnage was allotted for pod space, enhancing the ’Mech’s flexibility, while the remainder maximized armor coverage to see the Clan’s precious OmniMechs and its warriors home safely. The Shadow Cat III A configuration features only a ER Large Laser in each arm. Mobility has been substantially increased with the retention of the MASC system and the inclusion of eight pod mounted Improved Jump Jets to increase jump ranges 50% over the original Shadow Cat. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

The Shadow Cat III C configuration does away with all Jump Jets in favor of extreme ground mobility in the form of the standard MASC system and an engine Supercharger allowing it to reach burst speeds of up to 162kph. content.original: The Shadow Cat is a heavily-armed and maneuverable medium OmniMech developed by Clan Nova Cat to replace the Ice Ferret in the early 31st century during preparations for Operation Revival. This Dark Age configuration uses two Improved Heavy Large Lasers as its weaponry. To control the heat, seventeen double heat sinks are augmented by two Coolant Pods. Quirk: Narrow/Low Profile Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.04

content.original: The Shrike is outfitted with a powerful Targeting Computer that allows it to bring accurate firepower to bear on the battlefield. It has a hard-hitting armament that gives the 'Mech a powerful sting in combat at most ranges. A Long Bow LRM-10-rack allows pilots to engage enemies at long range, and two Type 9 Ultra Autocannon/5s are effective against even other assault-class 'Mechs. Lastly, two Series 2b ER Large Lasers provide a fairly powerful punch should the other weapon systems deplete their ammunition. The design owes its large weapon capacity to due use to its Endo Steel construction and its large 380-rated Extra-Light Fusion Engine. Engineers enhanced the design by adding a Partial Wing, giving the Shrike extra jump capacity as well as additional cooling abilities under normal atmospheric conditions. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

content.original: Black Rose is the personal 'Mech of the legendary Shrike MechWarrior Malvina Hazen, Jade Falcon Star Colonel and later Khan. Her 'Mech was later used as the inspiration for the SRK-3 variant. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.36

content.original: Though the Stinger IIC has a relatively low ground speed by Jihad Era standards, it is still fast enough to act as a harasser unit as well as a recon platform. The 180 meter jump capability is also useful, allowing the pilot to get out of tight terrain very quickly. The upgraded armor protection is valued by those warriors used to the older Stinger as well, but this armor is still too light to allow the 'Mech to operate in a stand up fight. Double Heat Sinks keep the Stinger IIC cool. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05
content.prevOriginal: Though the Stinger IIC has a relatively low ground speed by Jihad Era standards, it is still fast enough to act as a harasser unit as well as a recon platform. The 180 meter jump capability is also useful, allowing the pilot to get out of tight terrain very quickly. The upgraded armor protection is valued by those warriors used to the older Stinger as well, but this armor is still too light to allow the 'Mech to operate in a stand up fight. Double Heat Sinks keep the Stinger IIC cool. Quirk: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05
content.content: Хотя Stinger IIC имеет относительно низкую скорость по стандартам Эры Джихада, он все же он достаточно быстр, чтобы использоваться для разведки или преследования. Возможность прыжка на 180 метров также полезна, позволяя пилоту очень быстро выбраться из труднопроходимой местности. Модернизированная броня ценится воинами, которые пилотировали старый Stinger, но эта броня все еще слишком легкая, чтобы позволить меху принимать участие в прямых столкновениях. Double Heat Sink неплохо справляются с охлаждением Stinger IIC. Склонность: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

Вариант IIC-2 отличается от IIC-1 улучшенными системами слежения за целью и системами электронного противодействия, но установка этих систем несколько ухудшила его скорость и маневренность. Также модель IIC-2 лишилась прыжковых ускорителей. Склонность: Ubiquitous Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.05

content.original: A Dark Age configuration, the Strider H carries a pair of clan made Streak LRM-10's and 2 tons of ammo. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 0.97

content.original: The Summoner is a highly mobile heavy OmniMech that is commonly used in a wide variety of roles. Barely a second generation OmniMech, the Jade Falcons introduced the Summoner just after becoming the first Clan to win OmniMech technology from Clan Coyote in 2863. A configuration introduced in the Republic era, this version carries a Gauss Rifle, SRM-6, and an ER Large Pulse Laser. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.11

content.original: The Tenshi, ("Angel" in japanese), is an Assault Class OmniMech, which was manufactured during the early thirty-second century for the Draconis Combine's armed forces. A product of House Kurita's hidden efforts to rebuild its decimated 'Mech regiments, the Tenshi was designed to use resources found within the Combine. The Tenshi was first deployed among the ranks of the Ghost Regiments in the early 3100s, its deployment with a less-renowned brigade was part of the DCMS' two-fold effort of testing the 'Mech while also providing a fire-wall to save face should the design prove to be a failure in combat. One of its first deployments was in 3103, when the 1st Ghost conducted a raid on the Ghost Bear Dominionworld of Grumium. The eight Tenshis among the Ghosts' ranks performed well, with most of their numbers returning to the Combine with stolen Clan technology. Among the Tenshi's design features is its durability and having a heavy equipment payload. The designers saw fit to equip the 'Mech with a Compact Gyro and 18.5 tons of Standard Armor. The Tenshi also uses a number of new technologies that had finally entered production in the decades preceding the Jihad. The use of an Endo-Composite internal structure and a Light Fusion Engine granted the design a huge pod capacity of 48 tons. However, this large capacity had come at a price; that price being a slightly lower maximum speed than other comparable designs of the era." Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.12

content.original: The Thunderbolt IIC is a second-line heavy BattleMech that was originally developed for Clan Jade Falcon in 3085. The design came into existence due to that Clan's need to re-purpose surplus components being produced for their Loki and Thor OmniMech designs. Using one of Olivetti Weaponry's previous Inner Sphere designs, the classic Thunderbolt, they reworked it as a replacement for second-line 'Mechs lost during the Jihad. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.16

content.original: A much tougher BattleMech than its predecessor, the Viking IIC is protected by a massive 31 tons of GC Hardened Slab Armor. This is a dense and tough hardened armor, which while providing considerable protection in combat also slows the 'Mech down. Its lack of speed would make the Viking IIC unpopular with Clan warriors, who prefer swifter machines in combat. The foundation of toughness is also found in its GC Type 2C Endo Steel skeleton and a General Motors 270-Rated Fusion Engine. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

Its main weapons are four 20-tube Long-Range Missile Launchers split between the 'Mech's side torsos, with four tons of ammunition supplying the launchers. For closer engagements it has six Extended Range Medium Lasers divided in pairs and allocated to each of the 'Mech's arms and its center torso. content.original: The original Warhammer was designed as an assault BattleMech. However, it had been superseded by later and heavier 'Mech designs, though it remained a powerful weapons platform. The Clans wisely maintained and built on this solid frame a real assault 'Mech, the Warhammer IIC. Introduced in the Dark Age era, this version carries four ER Large Lasers supported by twin SRM-6 launchers. A single ER Small Laser rounds out the armament. It's powered by a standard fusion engine, but uses an Endo Steel frame and Ferro-fibrous armor. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

content.original: The original Warhammer was designed as an assault BattleMech. However, it had been superseded by later and heavier 'Mech designs, though it remained a powerful weapons platform. The Clans wisely maintained and built on this solid frame a real assault 'Mech, the Warhammer IIC. This version drops the ER PPCs and replaces them with experimental Rotary AC/5s. An XXL Fusion Engine provides enough power for a top speed of 86km/h. The RACs are backed up by a pair of ER Medium Lasers and ER Small Lasers, and the missile launcher is now an LRM-10. In addition to the Ferro-Fibrous Armor, an ECM Suite in the head disrupts enemy electronics. Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

content.original: Known and revered across the Inner Sphere and beyond, the Warhammer is the pre-eminent heavy Mech. Debuting in 2515, the 70 ton Mech is a solid blend of firepower and mobility designed to outfight almost any opponent. Powered by a 280 Fusion Core, the Warhammer WHM-8D2 is armed with a pair of ER PPC’s. A pair of ER Medium Lasers, ER Small Lasers and a Thunderbolt-5 deter opponents from closing in. CASE and a Boosted C3 Slave round out the design.\\n\\n Quirk: Integrated Searchlight Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.1

content.original: Standing at ten meters tall, the Watchman is a 'Mech that was born of necessity. The idea for the design came when the bulk of the AFFS was moved to the Clan front. Because this seriously undermined the ability of the Federated Suns to keep its borders secure, the Watchman was designed to be distributed to militia units within the border marches to bulk up their strength. In its own right the Watchman is a durable and reliable 'Mech that is built with off the shelf components and is very easy to repair. The 'Mech is armored with eight and a half tons of standard armor, has a top speed of 86.4 km/h, and can jump up to one hundred and fifty meters. This, combined with the Watchman's varied arsenal, makes it an excellent trooper or trainer. Quirk: Easy to Pilot Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.02

content.original: Manufactured on Kwangjong-ni by Defiance, the Zeus X was both a poster child for excellence in production engineering and an innovative high-technology platform. The -X3 carried four ER Medium Lasers in the right arm and an ER PPC in the left arm, connected to a Targeting Computer. The true uniqueness of the design came in its use of Improved Jump Jets: the -X3 could jump up to 240 meters, which rivaled the jumping capability of any light 'Mech. This combination of heavy armor, speed and firepower made -the X3 the nightmare of any light or medium 'Mech and could outmaneuver any heavy or assault 'Mech. The -X3 mounted seventeen double heat sinks. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.2

content.original: A modern take on the venerable SRM/LRM Carriers, the JES II Strategic Missile Carrier was a common missile based fire support vehicle in use in the early thirty-second century. A model sighted during the Dark Age era in 3088 mounted four Artemis IV enhanced LRM-20 in front with a single Artemis IV enhanced LRM-10 on each flank. It was also clad in Ferro-Fibrous armor. However to make room for all the equipment, the C3 Slave and Guardian ECM were removed, as was much of the armor. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 2/3 Hex: 60/90 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 90 50 Left 55 50 Right 55 50 Rear 40 50 Total 240 200

content.original: The Challenger X Main Battle Tank was designed to combat the threat the Clans posed to the Inner Sphere. Equipped with a 270 rated XL Engine, the Challenger X has a top speed of 54kph, allowing it to keep pace with formations of heavy units. The tank is protected by fourteen tons of  Ferro-Fibrous Armor with an anti-missile system providing additional protection from missiles. The Challenger's primary weaponry includes a turret mounted Gauss Rifle with two tons of ammo. For closer range threats, a LB 10-X Autocannon is also turret-mounted with two tons of ammo. An Artemis IV FCS-enhanced LRM-10 provides additional ranged firepower. To combat threats at short range, the Challenger X has a pair of Streak SRM 2 launchers protecting the sides of the tank, two front-mounted Medium Pulse Lasers and a rear-mounted Small Pulse Laser. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro Structure: Structure Values A S Front 425 45 Left 334 45 Right 334 45 Rear 277 45 Turret 340 45 Total 1710 225

content.original: Developed by the New Earth Trading Company in 2587, the Alacorn has developed a reputation as an effective and dependable tank. The design is popular with mercenary units and minor powers who can't afford BattleMechs, because of its heavy offensive weaponry and thirteen tons of armor; however, this payload is only possible through the use of an expensive and fragile 285 XL Engine. The three turret-mounted  Gauss Rifles allow the Alacorn to unleash devastating barrages at range, with five tons of reloads offering excellent endurance in combat. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro Structure: Structure Values A S Front 395 50 Left 215 50 Right 215 50 Rear 210 50 Turret 245 50 Total 1280 250

content.original: The Manticore II updated the venerable Manticore tank with advanced capabilities and a brand new tactical niche as an amphibious vehicle. Few tanks of similar power can match the Manticore II’s mobility in wet terrain. The unit is best employed at long range, emerging from a swamp or river to provide highly accurate support fire from an unexpected quarter. It has the technical capabilities to serve in a similar role as the Manticore, but its expense makes this a questionable use of a specialist machine. Slower than the Medium Tank, but possessing heavier armor and fire power, the Heavy Tank is a fearsome combatant. Trading speed or weapons for armor, the Heavy Tank can soak up a surprisingly heavy level of fire power. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 4/6 Hex: 120/180 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro Structure: Amphibious Hull Values A S Front 265 35 Left 200 35 Right 200 35 Rear 120 35 Turret 245 35 Total 1030 175

content.original: The Winston Combat Vehicle was a Republic of the Sphere frontline combat vehicle that began production in 3085. The Winston is a fire support type tank which generally uses its long range weaponry to hit its opponent. The vehicle's principle long range weapons include a pair of turret mounted 15-tubed Long Range Missile Launchers and pair of Light PPCs. The Light PPCs are guided by a Targeting Computer mounted in the hull of the tank. In close combat, the vehicle must rely on its front mounted 6-tubed Streak Short Range Missile Launcher. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: A modern take on the venerable SRM/ LRM Carriers, the JES II Strategic Missile Carrier was a common missile based fire support vehicle in use in the early thirty-second century. A model sighted during the Dark Age era in 3088 mounted four Artemis IV enhanced LRM-20 in front with a single Artemis IV enhanced LRM-10 on each flank. It was also clad in Ferro-Fibrous armor. However to make room for all the equipment, the C3 Slave and Guardian ECM were removed, as was much of the armor. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 2/3 Hex: 60/90 Meters. Armor: Armor Structure: Structure Values A S Front 90 50 Left 55 50 Right 55 50 Rear 40 50 Total 240 200

content.original: The Challenger X Main Battle Tank was designed to combat the threat the Clans posed to the Inner Sphere. Equipped with a 270 rated XL Engine, the Challenger X has a top speed of 54kph, allowing it to keep pace with formations of heavy units. The tank is protected by fourteen tons of  Ferro-Fibrous Armor with an anti-missile system providing additional protection from missiles. The Challenger's primary weaponry includes a turret mounted Gauss Rifle with two tons of ammo. For closer range threats, a LB 10-X Autocannon is also turret-mounted with two tons of ammo. An Artemis IV FCS-enhanced LRM-10 provides additional ranged firepower. To combat threats at short range, the Challenger X has a pair of Streak SRM 2 launchers protecting the sides of the tank, two front-mounted Medium Pulse Lasers and a rear-mounted Small Pulse Laser. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fuel Cell: Improved vehicle engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. Armor: Heavy Ferro Structure: Structure Values A S Front 425 45 Left 334 45 Right 334 45 Rear 277 45 Turret 340 45 Total 1710 225

content.original: Developed by the New Earth Trading Company in 2587, the Alacorn has developed a reputation as an effective and dependable tank. The design is popular with mercenary units and minor powers who can't afford BattleMechs, because of its heavy offensive weaponry and thirteen tons of armor; however, this payload is only possible through the use of an expensive and fragile 285 XL Engine. The three turret-mounted  Gauss Rifles allow the Alacorn to unleash devastating barrages at range, with five tons of reloads offering excellent endurance in combat. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. Movement: 3/5 Hex: 90/150 Meters. content.original: The Manticore II updated the venerable Manticore tank with advanced capabilities and a brand new tactical niche as an amphibious vehicle. Few tanks of similar power can match the Manticore II’s mobility in wet terrain. The unit is best employed at long range, emerging from a swamp or river to provide highly accurate support fire from an unexpected quarter. It has the technical capabilities to serve in a similar role as the Manticore, but its expense makes this a questionable use of a specialist machine. Slower than the Medium Tank, but possessing heavier armor and fire power, the Heavy Tank is a fearsome combatant. Trading speed or weapons for armor, the Heavy Tank can soak up a surprisingly heavy level of fire power. Tracked: High traction, agile turning. Fusion: Expensive engine that works in a Vacuum. content.original: The Winston Combat Vehicle was a Republic of the Sphere frontline combat vehicle that began production in 3085. The Winston is a fire support type tank which generally uses its long range weaponry to hit its opponent. The vehicle's principle long range weapons include a pair of turret mounted 15-tubed Long Range Missile Launchers and pair of Light PPCs. The Light PPCs are guided by a Targeting Computer mounted in the hull of the tank. In close combat, the vehicle must rely on its front mounted 6-tubed Streak Short Range Missile Launcher.
